thread.title: Hampton state Rep. David Wood arrested for OUI in Maine
thread.title_full: Hampton state Rep. David Wood arrested for OUI in Maine

author: Max Sullivan msullivan@seacoastonline.com
title: Hampton state Rep. David Wood arrested for OUI in Maine
text: Hampton state Rep. David Wood arrested for OUI in Maine Comment Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 4:39 PM Updated at 4:41 PM Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 4:39 PM Updated at 4:41 PM » Social News HAMPTON — A Hampton state representative was arrested over the weekend in Maine and charged with driving under the influence of alcohol, police said Monday. State Rep. David Wood, R-Hampton, faces one count of operating under the influence of alcohol following his arrest at 6:21 p.m. Friday, Oct. 16, in Gorham, Maine, according to Gorham police Sgt. Michael Nault. Wood is one of four people who represent Hampton in Rockingham District 21 in the New Hampshire House of Representatives. He was elected in 2014 and is a member of the House Public Works and Highways Committee. Nault said first offender's charge of OUI in Maine is punishable by a minimum $500 fine, 90 days loss of license and potentially two days in jail. Attempts to reach Wood, 62, of Ruth Lane, for comment were not successful on Monday. By Max Sullivan
